channel.title: January on CodeWithStu's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in January on CodeWithStu's Blog

item.title: Observed No. 5 - MACH Architectures
item.description: Welcome to the fifth edition of Observed! Your weekly newsletter, where I bring you a tip you can implement in your infrastructure across many categories like AWS, Terraform and General DevOps practices. This week’s edition looks at MACH architectures.

item.title: Observed No. 4 - Emerging Pattern: Centralised Ingress
item.description: Welcome to the fourth edition of Observed! Your weekly newsletter, where I bring you a tip you can implement in your infrastructure across many categories like AWS, Terraform and General DevOps practices. This week’s edition looks at a common pattern emerging across the industry: Centralised Ingress.

item.title: Observed No. 3 - Understanding Split Horizon DNS: How it works and How to Implement it in AWS
item.description: Welcome to the third edition of Observed! Your weekly newsletter, where I bring you a tip you can implement in your infrastructure across many categories like AWS, Terraform and General DevOps practices. This week’s edition looks at Split Horizon DNS.

item.title: Observed No. 2 - Upgrade Your Terraform Modules
item.description: Welcome to the second edition of Observed! Your weekly newsletter, where I bring you a tip you can implement in your infrastructure across many categories like AWS, Terraform and General DevOps practices. This week’s edition looks at a technique you can use to upgrade your Terraform modules.

item.title: Observed No. 1 - VPC Endpoint Policies
item.description: Welcome to the very first edition of Observed! Each week I bring you a tip you can implement in your infrastructure across many categories like AWS, Terraform and General DevOps practices. This week’s edition looks at VPC endpoint policies in AWS. What Are VPC Endpoints? VPC endpoints are network interfaces you can create in your VPC to enable communication between your VPC and other AWS services without using an Internet gateway, VPN, or VPC peering.
